intro: Erinus villosus, commonly known as the woolly erinus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive appearance and ease of care. Erinus villosus is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
